verses.verse: "You see, the empire of the heavens is like a person, a property owner, someone who went out at the same time as morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
After he agreed together with the workers for a denarius (a fifty-dollar coin) for the day, he sent them out into his vineyard.
And when he went out around the third hour (9:00 a. m.), he saw others that had stood idle in the marketplace.
And to those people he said, 'You also must go back into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.' But the people went away.
Again when he went out around the sixth (noon) and the ninth hour (3:00 p. m.), he did similarly.
Around the eleventh hour (5:00 p. m.) when he went out, he found others who had stood idle, and he says to them, 'Why have you stood here idle the whole day?'
They say to him, 'Because no one hired us.' He says to them, 'You also must go back into the vineyard, and whatever is right, you will receive.'
When it becomes evening, the master of the vineyard says to his administrator, 'Call the workers, and give out the pay to them, beginning from the last until the first.'
And when the 'around the eleventh hour (5:00 p. m.)' workers came, they received a denarius (a fifty-dollar coin) apiece.
And when the first workers came, they assumed that they will receive more, and they also received a denarius (a fifty-dollar coin) apiece.
After they received it, they were grumbling against the property owner,
saying, 'These last workers made one hour, and you made them equal to us, the ones who hauled the heavy weight of the day and the hot wind.'
When the property owner responded, he said to one of them, 'Comrade, I did not do anything wrong to you. Didn't you agree together with me for a denarius (a fifty-dollar coin)?
Take what is yours, and go back home. I want to give to this last worker as I also gave to you.
Or am I not permitted to do what I want with my things? Tell me if your eye is evil because I am good.'
This is how the last will be first and the first last. You see, many are invited, but few are select."
And as Jesus was walking up into Jerusalem, He took the twelve students along by themselves on the way and said to them,
"Look, I am walking up into Jerusalem. And the Son of the Person will be turned over to the head priests and Old Testament transcribers, and they will find Him guilty with death.
And they will turn Him over to the non-Jews for the 'to mock, to whip, and to nail to a cross' part. And on the third day, He will stand up."
At that time, the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to Him with her sons, bowing down and asking for something from the side of Him.
He said to her, "What do you want?" She says to Him, "Say that these two sons of mine will be seated, one at places to the right of You and one at places to the left of You, in Your empire."

When Jesus answered, He said, "You do not realize what you are asking for. Are you able to drink the cup that I am going to be drinking and be submerged in the submersion that I am being submerged in?" They say to Him, "We are able."

And He says to them, "You will certainly drink My cup and be submerged in the submersion that I am submerged in, but the permission to be seated at places to the right of Me and at places to the left of Me is not Mine to give. But it is for whom it has been readied by My Father."
And when the ten heard, they were infuriated about the two brothers.
When Jesus called for them, He said, "You realize that the head people of the non-Jews act like masters over them and the huge people put themselves in authority over them.
It will not be like this among you, but whoever wants to become huge among you, he must be a servant of you.
And whoever wants to be first among you, he must be a slave of you,
even as the Son of the Person did not come to be served, but to serve and to give His soul as a payment for the release of many."
And as they traveled out from Jericho, a big crowd followed Him.
And look, when two blind people sitting along the road heard that Jesus is passing by, they yelled, saying, "Show us forgiving kindness, Master, Son of David."
The crowd forbid them so that they would be silent. But the two were yelling louder, saying, "Show us forgiving kindness, Master, Son of David."
And when Jesus stood still, He hollered for them and said, "What do you want that I would do for you?"
They say to Him, "Master, that our eyes would be opened."
After Jesus had sympathy, He touched their eyes. And right away their eyes saw again, and they followed Him.
